snippet: AARON--Daniel. The trustees and staff of the Library of America are saddened by the death of Life Trustee and founding president Daniel Aaron. The Library of America - a nonprofit cultural institution created in 1979 to publish authoritative editions of America's best and most significant writing for a wide audience of general readers, scholars, and students - embodies Dan's conviction that American literature is the key to understanding the nation's history and character, and worthy of being preserved and celebrated. Elizabeth W. Smith, Chair of the Board; Cheryl Hurley, President 1/3
lead_paragraph: AARON--Daniel. The trustees and staff of the Library of America are saddened by the death of Life Trustee and founding president Daniel Aaron. The Library of America - a nonprofit cultural institution created in 1979 to publish authoritative editions of America's best and most significant writing for a wide audience of general readers, scholars, and students - embodies Dan's conviction that American literature is the key to understanding the nation's history and character, and worthy of being preserved and celebrated. Elizabeth W. Smith, Chair of the Board; Cheryl Hurley, President 1/3
